page.title: 14Skelmersdale New Town Border
page.content: The Skelmersdale NEW TOWN DEVELOPMENT road by-passes COBBS BROW LANE and runs parallel to it down to a roundabout to meet up again with Cobbs Brow. S.N.T.D. comprises{new roads, a secondary school} & an official rubbish dump. Between the new & old roads are fields with rough pasture. The others had gorse and grass bordered by deciduous trees mainly oak, beech & silver birch probably around 8 years old. Next to the "Roughs" was a {derelict farmhouse} & 2 acres of land owned by Mr.Burton who uses leaf mould from the "Roughs" to make potting compost.{SANDY LANE,NEWBURGH:}The houses were built in 1976. They have slate roofs & are made from brick. They have double glazing,a porch,garage 3 bedrooms 2 with fitted wardrobes, d\stairs toilet,u\stairs bathroom, dining room,kitchen,utility room,study.
